refnamediv.refpurpose: Push one or more elements onto the end of array

refentry.refsect1:
&reftitle.description;
intarray_push arrayarray mixedvar mixed...
array_push treats array as a stack, and pushes the passed variables onto the end of array. The length of array increases by the number of variables pushed. Has the same effect as:
<?php $array[] = $var; ?>
repeated for each var.
If you use array_push to add one element to the array it's better to use $array[] = because in that way there is no overhead of calling a function.
array_push will raise a warning if the first argument is not an array. This differs from the $var[] behaviour where a new array is created.

&reftitle.parameters;
array
The input array.
var
The pushed value.

&reftitle.returnvalues;
Returns the new number of elements in the array.
